description: Sub division of the ground floor shop (A1 use class) to provide an 8 unit indoor market (A1 use class) and the conversion of the upper floors from 2 x 3 bedroom flats to 4 x 1 bedroom flats, involving the construction of a new shop front, a two storey rear extension, 2 x rear dormer roof extensions, an external staircase with security fencing, basement extension, refuse storage, cycle parking, and a service vehicle parking space (following the demolition of the existing single storey canopy extension to the rear).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: PA-01 Revision 14/10/2011 (Existing and Proposed Floorplans), PA-02 Revision 14/10/2011 (Existing and Proposed Elevations), PA-03 Revision 10/11/2011 (OS Location Plan and Proposed Site Plan), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Samples of the materials and finishes to be used for the external surfaces of the development and detailed drawings of the design and external appearance of the replacement shopfront shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason:	To ensure that the materials and finishes harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.7, 4.10, and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and policies 7.8 and 7.9 of the London Plan (2011). | The proposed first floor kitchen window in the eastern elevation, and bathroom windows in the northern elevation of flat 1, and the bathroom windows in the eastern and southern elevations of flat 2 in the development hereby approved shall contain only obscure glass. A sample of the obscured glass, no smaller than 300 mm square shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development, and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the sample thus approved.  The details so approved shall be retained permanently thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A loading, delivery and freight management plan including measures to avoid multiple/ simultaneous deliveries and restrict vehicle size and management arrangements and prevent obstruction of the rear service alleyway for other users shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the first use of the development. The development shall be implemented and operated only in accordance with the approved details, and the approved arrangements shall be permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: In the interests of highway safety, maintaining the functionality of the rear service alleyway, protect the living and working conditions of nearby residents and workers, all in accordance policies 4.1, 5.5 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A refuse management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first use of the development hereby permitted and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area.in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 (Refuse Storage). | Notwithstanding the information on the submitted plans, the toilet in flat 3 in the development hereby approved shall be set out to provide a lateral transfer in accordance with the Council's Supplementary Planning Document 7 (Accessible Ealing).  Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers and users, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 (Accessible Ealing), and policy 7.2 of The London Plan (2011). | Details of sound attenuation measures from external noise together with ventilation for the proposed residential flats shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall thereafter be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, which shall be retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 (Noise and Vibration), and policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2011). | The ground floor of the premises, known as 57-59 The Green, Southall shall be used as an indoor retail market only (A1 use) and for no other purposes within the schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended), including any other use within class A1, without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason:  To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area, and to enable the local planning authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use at ground floor level in the interests of the function of the town centre in accordance with policies  7.1, 7.4 and 7.8  of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and policies 4.7 and 4.8 of The London Plan (2011). | The retail market hereby approved shall not operate outside the hours of 08:00 - 22:00hrs Mondays to Saturdays, and 10:00 - 20:00hrs Sundays and Public Holidays.  Reason: To enable the local planning authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, and to protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, and Policy 7.15 of the London Plan. | Deliveries to and from the site shall not operate outside the hours of 07:30 -22:00 hrs, on any day.  Reason: To enable the local planning authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, and to protect the living conditions of occupiers in the locality in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, Policy 7.15 of The London Plan (2011). | A total of 2 secure, lockable and covered cycle parking spaces shall be provided on the site prior to the first use of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with the policy 9.6 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004)
